title: Initials 3D Object:
description: This 3D object is made with the three initials of the designer’s name. It symbolizes her style: playful, yet organized.

title: Initials 3D Object:
description: This 3D object is made with the three initials of the designer’s name. It symbolizes her style: playful, yet organized. The hand gives some insight on the dimensions of the object.

title: Lollipop Font Fold-out booklet:
description: Lollipop font is created out of 6 different shapes within a grid with 2/3 ratio. The font is playful and full of energy. The booklet suggest how the font could be used and, in this case, folds out to a poster.

title: Lollipop Font Poster:
description: Lollipop font is created out of 6 different shapes within a grid with 2/3 ratio. The font is playful and full of energy. The back of the booklet shows the poster mentioned before.

title: Coronaposter:
description: Corona infiltrated people’s lives in 2020, global panic was real and stores got plundered by scared customers. This typographic poster contains an object that was sold out in almost every store during March 2020. It has been displayed on Koninging Astridplein by Billboard Project Antwerp and sold later on for the benefit of a good cause, the Suicide Line.

title: Creative alphabet:
description: Just having some fun with letters.

title: Four Word Poster:
description: Words, meaning the exact opposite, designed with different typographic letters to express the meaning of each word.

title: Graphic Trailer Cover:
description: This booklet is a visual trailer for the movie 'Lost in Translation'. The cover was made with bright colours, which refers to the bright colours used throughout the city.

title: Graphic Trailer Page:
description: his booklet is a visual trailer for the movie 'Lost in Translation'. Mixed feelings, uncertainty and doubts are like a thread through the movie, as well through this page.

title: Graphic Trailer Bookbinding:
description: The booklet is binded by using a Japanese binding: pages are folded in two and the open side of the folding is binded together.

title: Kaleidoscope Font:
description: A kaleidoscope creates an image that exists out of a continually changing pattern of shapes and colours, which is why this name was chosen. This font is created from a grid consisting out of rectangles and circles. From this grid three different weights were created. The font was made out of shapes that where placed on the grid. This has resulted in a colorful and playful font that seems to dance on the page. Find out more about the font on <a href=https://kaleidoscope-font.netlify.app/index.html>

title: Kaleidoscope Font - Stampset:
description: The Kaleidoscope font is created on a grid. Use these grid stamps on any paper and start making your own letters with the kaleidoscope grid! Find out more about the font on: <a href=https://kaleidoscope-font.netlify.app/index.html>

title: Kaleidoscope Postcard 'g':
description: A postcard that presents the letter 'g' from the Kaleidoscope font. Find out more about the font on the Kaleidoscope website.

title: Photocollage:
description: A photocollage on a grid.

title: Photocollage:
description: A photocollage on a grid.

title: The man with the moviecamera -Poster:
description: A quote from Dziga Vertov was used as an inspiration for this poster. This poster is made out of a quote from 'Dziga Vertov'.

title: Rasterized Booklet:
description: Experiments with 'Rasterizing' and 'Bitmap' in Photoshop.

title: Rasterized Booklet:
description: Experiments with 'Rasterizing' and 'Bitmap' in Photoshop.

title: Rasterized Booklet:
description: Experiments with 'Rasterizing' and 'Bitmap' in Photoshop.

title: First Screen Print:
description: A Screen Print Work made in the atelier of Sint Lucas Antwerp.

title: Gradient Flag:
description: A flag, already an object always on the move, with a design which accentuates movement even more.

title: Fold-out Flyer:
description: This fold-out poster is made under the theme of graphic designer Fons Hickmann. It contains several works and references to his website.

title: Fold-out Poster:
description: This fold-out poster is made under the theme of graphic designer Fons Hickmann. The back of the poster represents himself as well as his team.

title: The Serving Library Magazine:
description: The Serving Library is a traveling exhibition that has been installed indefinitely at 019, an art gallery, in Ghent since the autumn of 2020. Various elements of these works have been used and were implemented in the publication shown above.

title: The Serving Library Magazine:
description: The Serving Library is a traveling exhibition that has been installed indefinitely at 019, an art gallery, in Ghent since the autumn of 2020. Various elements of these works have been used and were implemented in the publication shown above.

title: The Serving Library Magazine:
description: The Serving Library is a traveling exhibition that has been installed indefinitely at 019, an art gallery, in Ghent since the autumn of 2020. Various elements of these works have been used and were implemented in the publication shown above.

title: The Serving Library Magazine:
description: The Serving Library is a traveling exhibition that has been installed indefinitely at 019, an art gallery, in Ghent since the autumn of 2020. Various elements of these works have been used and were implemented in the publication shown above.

title: Endings - By-end:
description: This series of posters (3) show different meanings of the end using three variations of the term ‘The End', 'Neverending' and 'By-end'. This poster contains the word 'by-end', which is seen as a selfish motive.

title: Endings - Neverending:
description: This series of posters (3) show different meanings of the end using three variations of the term ‘The End', 'Neverending' and 'By-end'. This poster contains the variation 'Neverending'. The continued growth of new leaves despite the 'captivity in the pot' of the plant.

title: Endings - The end:
description: This series of posters (3) show different meanings of the end using three variations of the term 'The End', 'Neverending' and 'By-end'. The last poster contains the variation 'The End'. The senescence of all living organisms, which unevitably leads to death of the leaf.

title: Zeitsprunge Poster:
description: Zeitsprunge means ‘time jump’. In this poster a link was made between activities linked with a more classic or modern vibe. Classical Ballet and the modern sport of Padel (which has actually been around for a long time but is only now finding its fame). This poster is a screen print, made with white, blue and silver ink on black paper.

title: Rixou Font - App:
description: Rixou is a modern and high-tech underground city beneath a nature reserve. For this city, a corporate identity was designed which is modern, but also radiates nature. An app was therefore indispensable for a high-tech city.

title: Rixou Font - Reusable bag:
description: Rixou is a modern and high-tech underground city beneath a nature reserve. For this city, a corporate identity was designed which is modern, but also radiates nature. An app was therefore indispensable for a high-tech city.

title: Rixou Font - Booklet:
description: Rixou is a modern and high-tech underground city beneath a nature reserve. For this city, a corporate identity was designed, which is modern but also radiates nature. This publication contains a guideline how to use this corporate identity.

title: Rixou Font - Poster:
description: Rixou is a modern and high-tech underground city beneath a nature reserve. For this city, a corporate identity was designed, which is modern but also radiates nature. The poster is an image to put this advanced city in the spotlights.

title: Rixou Font - Poster:
description: Rixou is a modern and high-tech underground city beneath a nature reserve. For this city, a corporate identity was designed, which is modern but also radiates nature. The poster is an image to put this advanced city in the spotlights.
